conclusion: Determine electric field and potential at center O after placing opposite-sign charge at C.
Equilateral triangle with vertices A, B, C; like charges at A and B; electric field at O is E.
Equilateral triangle with vertices A, B, C.
Electric field due to point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric fields at O due to charges at A and B are in the same direction.
Electric field due to opposite-sign charge at C is in opposite direction to fields from A and B.
Net electric field at O is vector sum of fields from A, B, C; components cancel out horizontally.
Magnitude of net electric field at O is E_net = E - E = 0.
Electric potential at distance r from point charge q is V = kq/r.
Initial electric potential at O due to charges at A and B is V_initial = 2kq/r.
Electric potential due to charge at C at O is V_C = -kq/r.
Net electric potential at O is V_net = 2kq/r - kq/r = kq/r.
Final answer: electric field at O is 0, electric potential at O is kq/r.
